intro: Ancistrocarpus brevispinosus, commonly known as the short-spined hibiscus, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with short, stiff spines along the edges. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
